title: Man Utd and Arsenal tipped to make move for Celtic striker Odsonne Edouard
text:

Odsonne Edouard has been told that if he moves to the Premier League then it should be to Manchester United or Arsenal and not a mid-table side.

Striker Edouard has scored five goals in seven appearances in the Scottish Premiership this season, to go with four goals in European competitions

That comes after the 21-year-old netted 14 times last season after he had signed from Paris Saint-Germain for £9million.

Scottish legend Kris Boyd reckons that if Edouard was to leave it shouldn't be for a side fighting relegation, instead he should be targeting one of the top six.

He told The Scottish Sun: “For what it’s worth, if it’s the Premier League he heads for, it should be for one of the giants, Manchester United or Arsenal, and not, with respect, to a Brighton or Southampton .

(Image: Getty Images)

“But I’ve got a funny feeling he’ll have to go and prove himself first at one of those clubs.”

But Celtic boss Neil Lennon has insisted that he plans to keep hold of Edouard in January.

“There’s no chance of him leaving in January," Lennon said. "Absolutely not.

"We’ve got too much to do here. He is a class player and is pivotal to us.

“We may or may not be in Europe after January, so that’s even more reason for him not to go.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

“It wouldn’t hinge on that, absolutely not. But it would be a nice carrot for him, a reason to settle himself.

“I don’t like watching him playing for other teams. When I heard about his hat-trick, I was like: Oh no!

“But, seriously, it is great for the profile of the club.

"I think it is fantastic for him that he is playing so well for club and country.

“He will be linked with everybody in the next couple of weeks and come the end of January, but we are in no position to sell.

“Speaking to his representatives, they’re really happy with the way things are going, as well. So long may that continue and he’s a real cool customer.

“I think he’ll leave it to other people to worry about who is interested, if that comes up.

“He’s been outstanding this season in all the games. He’s playing, he looks happy, his all-round game is coming on and his goals now are starting to be something else.

“He’s turned himself into a really prolific goal scorer and looks in a really good place at the minute.

We forget how young he is. He’s still only 21, so we don’t want to put any extra pressure on him.

“But he takes on a lot of responsibly by being, more or less, the No. 9 here at the minute and he’s revelling in it.”
description: Odsonne Edouard has netted five goals in seven appearances for Celtic this season which should make the likes of Man Utd and Arsenal take notice
